remarks: Two ways of saying that an element of a group is the identity element. Provides a convenient way to compute the value of the identity element. (Contributed by NM, 24-Aug-2011.)
statement:
grpinveu.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
grpinveu.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
grpinveu.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
grpid $p |- ( ( G e. Grp /\ X e. B ) -> ( ( X .+ X ) = X <-> .0. = X ) ) $.
